intro: Codivalia patula, commonly known as the slender codivia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to tolerate salt spray. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
